reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were forging our way across the country as quickly as possible in our drive from Tallahassee to San Francisco, and this was the town we spent our last hotel night in. I'm sure it would have been fine had we not been put in a smoking room because we had our two dogs with us. Relegating people with pets into a smelly smelly smoker's room should NOT count as being pet friendly! The smell was awful, the hotel, as previously described by other reviewers is very basic and fine; the free breakfast might as well not have existed, there wasn't anything worth eating. Not a fan.

Basic Western
reviews.text: We hadn't done any research on Needles hotels because we originally planned on spending the night in Kingman. When in doubt I often choose a Best Western, although they have been disappointing me during the past year.

This BW is as basic as they get. No breakfast at this BW either, not even donuts or coffee in the lobby. Toilet flooded the bathroom every time it was flushed. Fortunately the water emerged from the tank and not the bowl.

reviews.text: Needles isn't a big town and judging by some surrounding motels [ala Route 66 vintage], this BW is probably your best bet, but only for one night, just a place to sleep.
